alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 04 at 9:50PM CDT until November 05 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR NORTHWESTERN BARRY AND SOUTH CENTRAL LAWRENCE COUNTIES... At 950 PM CDT, Gauge reports indicated between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the warned area. While heavy rain has ended, lingering runoff from recent heavy rainfall will continue. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monett, Aurora, Purdy, Wheaton, Verona, Butterfield, Pioneer, Mcdowell, Pleasant Ridge and Ridgley. This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Center Creek at County Road 2220, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110 and North Fork Clear Creek at Nellie Avenue. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
